H0.text: A large mass of ice and snow accumulates is the statement that describes the formation of a delta.

H1.text: A mound of sand built by wind is a statement that describes the formation of a delta.

H2.text: A low area of land surrounded by mountains is the statement that describes the formation of a delta.

H3.text: A mass of sediment is deposited at the mouth of a river is the statement that describes the formation of a delta.

A4.text: River deltas form when a river carrying sediment reaches a body of water, such as a lake, ocean, or a reservoir. When the flow enters the standing water, it is no longer confined to its channel and expands in width. This flow expansion results in a decrease in the flow velocity, which diminishes the ability of the flow to transport sediment.

A5.text: As a result, sediment drops out of the flow and is deposited as alluvium, which builds up to form the river delta.
